DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate effectiveness administer Lidocaine Epinephrine use iontophoretic device treatment provide local anesthesia healthy adult volunteer subject undergoing venipuncture .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Study Iontophoretic Patch Containing Lidocaine Epinephrine Venipuncture Healthy Adult Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Subjects may race , either sex , must > 18 year age Healthy subject per medical screening Subjects must intact , healthy skin ( tattoos , surgical scar , skin infection , etc . ) iontophoresis treatment perform Subjects must alert , orient , mentally competent , able understand comply requirement study Subjects must sign date write informed consent Female subject childbearing potential must negative pregnancy test result prior iontophoresis treatment Subjects know allergy sensitivity lidocaine , epinephrine local anesthetic amide ester type Subjects know sensitivity component ( e.g . adhesive ) IDDSSubjects undergone venipuncture treatment area within prior 2 week longer bruise hematoma apparent Subjects take analgesic pain medication 24hour period prior venipuncture posterior surface hand Subjects skin allergy skin disease ( e.g . psoriasis , eczema Subjects open skin lesion treatment site Subjects pregnant breastfeeding Subjects expose investigational drug device within past 30 day involve concurrently treatment clinical trial Subjects participate previous DTI/Transcu clinical study relate product Subjects known concurrent illness Subjects `` current '' known/admitted substance abuse ( alcohol/drug ) Subjects pacemaker and/or externally mount electronic device Current history condition contraindicate use iontophoretic treatment venipuncture
